text: Eva McPherson Clayton (born September 16, 1934) is an American Democratic politician. When she was elected to the United States House of Representatives in 1992, Clayton became the first African American to represent North Carolina in the House since 1898. She retired from politics in 2003. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from North Carolina Category:People from Savannah, Georgia Category:Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:African-American politicians
title: Eva Clayton
